intro: Heliophila goldblattii, commonly known as the golden blatt, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its attractive, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a distinctive, often hairy texture. Heliophila goldblattii is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
